column2: A module error at start-up.
column3:
Switch power off, then on again. 
If the error recurs, the module may have failed. Consult your local Mitsubishi service center or representative.

column2: The G(P).OGSTOR instruction was executed in the offset/gain setting mode.
column3: Do not execute the G(P).OGSTOR instruction in the offset/gain setting mode.

column2:
* The G(P).OGSTOR instruction was executed consecutively.
* At the time of offset/gain setting, a set value was written to the E2PROM 26 or more times.
column3:
* Execute the G(P).OGSTOR instruction only once for one module.
* At the time of offset/gain setting, write a set value only once at one time.

column2:
* The G(P).OGSTOR instruction was executed for the model that differs from the model for which the G(P).OGLOAD instruction had been executed.
* The G(P).OGSTOR instruction had been executed before the G(P).OGLOAD instruction was executed.
column3:
* Execute the G(P).OGLOAD and G(P).OGSTOR instructions for the same model.
* Execute the G(P).OGLOAD instruction first, then G(P).OGSTOR instruction.

column2: The CH1 set warning output upper/lower limit value is outside the measurable temperature range specified for the used platinum temperature-measuring resistor. (The lower lower limit value is lower than the measurement range.)
